result.execSummary:
The defendant Shad Michael Opolka Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs, service fees, DNA surcharge, and $100 buy money--  Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with known drug users or anyone on probation for a drug offense--except for in treatment/meetings.
Def must submit DNA sample on 12-2-16

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shad Michael Opolka in court with attorney Bradley John Priebe.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3pm
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Priebe spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
2 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision. Eligible for CIP & SAP.
Conditions of ES:
Pay costs,$95SF,  DNA surcharge and $100 buy money-Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Def must give DNA sample today
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with known drug users or anyone on probation for a drug offense- except for in treatment/meetings 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment  
Undergo assessments, treatments, and counseling as recommended by agent
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Def remanded into custody of MSD
Appeal rights

Defendant Shad Michael Opolka in court with attorney Robert James Sisson.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:05pm
Atty Sisson requests to withdraw from case, substitute Atty Priebe
Def does not object
Court grants substitution of atty
ADA spks on agreement
Court arraigns def
Def pleads n/c
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Plea quest/WOR
Fact basis
Court finds def guilty
Court orders a PSI- Agent to provide the report to the Clerk of Courts office at least 10 days prior to sentencing.
Atty Sisson spks- requests sentencing date in January
Court will not post pone sentencing until next year
Def must contact DOC today to set up appt for PSI
Court sets $25,000 signature bond
Waiver of Extradition
No alcohol or controlled susbtances without valid prescription
Comply with all court orders  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
